I will explain: We are in a period very similar to stagflation
created_at: i.e. crisis + inflation. That is why the best stocks tend to be commodities (raw materials and transport)
column3: of course technology has fallen quite a lot because they are intangible assets and these give only long term benefits. So
column4: with the rise in freight rates
column5: shipping lines continue to increase their revenues
column6: due to 1. the collapse of the ports and the high demand for shipping containers and 2. the Ukrainian war that 'favours' the rise in the price of raw materials (inflation). In addition
column7: it should be noted that the port of Shanghai is gradually improving and there will be work to smooth out the bottlenecks. ZIM is a company that is more than half a century old
column8: with fairly healthy accounts and a good ratio to meet its debt repayments.
